channel.title: Soulsplit
channel.description: Soulsplit is so popular right so I got on it and it sucked I am wondering... why is it so popular? -.-

SS is complete crap, IMO fact.

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“firstchoice8, post:61, topic:528741”][quote author=Travas link=topic=647496.msg4357293#msg4357293 date=1377957361]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=647496.msg4357084#msg4357084 date=1377904874]

Now I just find it sad how a kid uses his parent’s wealth for a private server. Oh well, his choice.
[/quote]regardless of how much he spent to advertise in the beginning, he makes bank now.
[/quote]He didn’t make bank back then, so I wouldn’t waste my parent’s money on a private server that only had a slim chance to become popular. That’s just me, though.

Unless he took it without his parents permission I don’t find it sad, if they gave it to him he’s allowed to spend it on whatever he wants, and it really payed off now.[/quote]Exactly. Just like people spend their money on RSPS donation items, or Runescape gold/powerleveling. If they have the money, they can spend it how they wish. What we believe is stupid may not be stupid to them.

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

I hosted a server a while ago and had a staff member who had been a staff member on soulsplit for a time. He denied there being any sort of agreement between jagex and ss, but he did confirm that pim and his family are extremely wealthy, and that wealth was used for a lot of startup advertisements/paid developers/any other expense. That’s probably the main reason they’ve been up for so long. Money makes the world go 'round, right?

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“thakillah, post:53, topic:528741”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=647496.msg4355913#msg4355913 date=1377569000]

This is really interesting, i don’t play SS myself but they must have some sort of agreement with Jagex, the only thing that makes sense.

No.
[/quote]I’d like to hear your explanation on how SS is still alive while other private servers that were the same size were raped by jagex, then. There is no proof that they have an agreement, but it’s the only normal explanation.

Alot of what people have been telling me is simply because of where their VPS is located.

That is a ridiculous thought.

Actually, I just discovered something that might make that idea a bigger possibility.

Unless they’re located in Ukraine/Outskirts of Russa/China/Korea, then their location is useless.

Just telling from the word on the street. But people are telling me it is in the Netherlands.

I live in the netherlands and if I would host ss from where I live i would be sued quite some time ago the rules here are like every other europian country.[/quote]

ox random xi:

Unless they’re located in Ukraine/Outskirts of Russa/China/Korea, then their location is useless.

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @Pker_DX Pker DX
item.description:
@Pker_DX wrote:

As a long time player, SS has changed so much, their playerbase is only 1/3 of what it was in early 2012.
This is because of a few things
Soulsplit 2
The ‘perfect’ combat system
The wrecked eco

SoulSplit 2
One step further in RSPS Clients, agreed, but the gameplay is junk compared to SS1, It’s so buggy, it downloads the cache as you play (which is bad in places like the wildy), The maps are blacktriangled all over the place, And much more.

The ‘perfect’ combat system
No. It’s awful, its even worse than the first, wearing a blessed ss + karils/ahrims/dharok/guthan/torag/karil and the other person has 70 attack/range/mage or less, your invincible. + torva and divines def takes the mick

Wrecked Eco
All items that are 12k credits or less have crashed badly, arcanes are now 120m, steads are 80m, bandos sets are 200m, claws are 370m, korasi 370m, ags 360m, vesta sets 80m, vls 50m
you get the point

It’s just ruined.

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @IceKy IceKy

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

xI c E:

As others have said, advertising and a dedicated team. I just noticed they have ads pretty much anywhere you navigate if you don’t have any “credits” or are a guest, which only implies they spend a significant amount of their earnings paying their team, costs for hosting, and advertising. Adding onto the discussion of a potential agreement with Jagex; it’s possible (and the most logical reason), they’ve taken down a lot of other servers but never put up a single fist against Soulsplit. However, you also have to ask yourself; if they’re doing this so called agreement, then why didn’t they do it with others that they’ve shut down?

I don’t believe this agreement rumor rubbish.
Then again, I’ve been wrong before.

Read full topic

item.title: Soulsplit
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“xxlukexx, post:37, topic:528741”]Could be true. When #2 got taken down(Jagex) Pim basically tried to lure all the players over to SS by saying he’ll make another server pretty much like what it was.

Of course it never happened but no doubt some people stayed. Also heard he’s bought a few cars too, must be nice to do nothing and rake in money.[/quote]

He has like a 100,000 audi he couldnt even drive because he wasnt the legal age in his country

Read full topic
